name: Fieldwork: Vendor Master File (VMF) Review
description: The Vendor Master File (VMF) Review control is designed to validate that all additions and changes to the Vendor Master File are properly supported, independently reviewed, and approved by an authorized individual prior to being recorded in the system.

data.label: Obtain a log of VMF changes
data.description: Obtain a log of VMF changes for the requested period
data.instructions:
Connect to the ERP system to retrieve the Vendor Master File change log for the review period. The data set will include, at a minimum:
- Supplier Name
- Supplier Number
- Supplier creation date
- Supplier change date
- Type of change (New, Update)
- Address
- Updated Address
- Bank Name
- Updated Bank Name
- Bank Account Num
- Updated Bank Account Num
- Payment Method (ACH, PCARD, CHECK)
- Updated Payment Method (ACH, PCARD, CHECK)
- Updated By

data.label: Sample selection
data.description: Select a random sample of the VMF changes from the log
data.instructions:
1. Determine the total population size.
2. Apply the audit sampling methodology (e.g., attribute sampling) to determine sample size.
3. Use a random or systematic selection method to pick the sample.
4. Document the sample selection criteria and the final list of items to be tested.

data.label: Request Support for each sample
data.description: Locate supporting documents for each sample
data.instructions:
Connect to the SharePoint Site and locate the following support for each sample:
- Vendor request emails or written change requests (should include the name of the person approving the change)
- New vendor setup form, W-9, or vendor change request forms,  invoices, purchase orders or other relevant supporting evidence
- Delegation of Authority (DoA) matrix identifying individuals authorized to approve VMF changes

data.label: Attribute A - Independent Approval
data.description: Each vendor master file change request is approved by an authorized associate who is independent of the individual entering the change into the system.
data.instructions:
For each sample do the following:
1. Validate that an approval email exists for the change.
2. Confirm that the approver has the appropriate level of authority in accordance with the Delegation of Authority (DOA).
3. Verify that the approver is not the same individual who initiated the change

data.label: Attribute C - Changes are supported
data.description: Changes recorded in the Vendor Master File agree to the supporting documentation and accurately reflect the requested and approved information.
data.instructions:
For each sample:
Validate that all data elements created or modified are supported by and consistent with appropriate supporting documentation (e.g., vendor email, invoice, purchase order, Wâ€‘9).

data.label: Attribute B - Approval was obtained prior to the change
data.description: Approval for the vendor master file change is obtained prior to the change being made in the system.
data.instructions:
For each sample do the following:
Validate that documented approval for the new record or change was obtained prior to the effective date of the change in the system.

data.label: Document Findings and Exceptions
data.description: Summarize the results of the testing and document any identified exceptions or control gaps.
data.instructions:
1. Compile a list of all identified exceptions (e.g., missing support, lack of approval, data entry errors).
2. Quantify the error rate based on the sample.
3. Draft preliminary findings including the root cause and potential impact of the control failure.
